GAL is looking for an experienced Embedded Software Test Engineer with C/C++ experience to work in the PCB operations team.

jobs.title: Java and C++ Developer
jobs.description: The company is developing a new, critical, middle office messaging infrastructure to handle a high volume of trade execution and allocation messages on the UNIX platform and pass these to back-office systems for processing. Message sources include exchange drops utilizing standard FIX tag protocol or exchange-defined TCP/IP formats as well as client-sourced messages via FIX or FTP files. As... messages are received, they will need to be validated, formatted, and passed via EMS and MQ to downstream applications for back office processing. Prospective candidate will need to analyze and document the existing processing rules for each of the current message sources on the UNIX platform and develop new JAVA processes to consume these messages and forward them via MQ to downstream applications in a real-time environment. All processes will need to have restart/recovery capability. The ideal candidate should be knowledgeable in multi-threading, relational database systems, C/C++, Java, and associated debuggers. Strong written and oral communication skills a plus. Skills & Requirements• Candidate MUST be experienced in Java as well as C++ Minimum of 3 years professional experience in C / C++ / UNIX / Perl / Java • Strong data structures, multi-threading, and database skills. Experience in Sybase or UDB required. • Knowledge of FIX protocol and financial industry • Perl, Eclipse expertise a plus • Ability to work independently with minimal assistance • Strong problem solving skills: able to logically break down a problem into smaller manageable parts to solve

Leveraging your expertise in C++ programming and ultra-low-latency technologies, you will lead a team of developers, ensuring that our trading systems remain at the forefront of speed, reliability, and efficiency.

Qualifications:

• Extensive experience in C++ development with a strong focus on low-latency, high-performance systems.
• Proven track record of designing and optimizing trading systems for ultra-low latency.
• Deep understanding of financial markets, high-frequency trading, and algorithmic trading strategies.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

jobs.title: Mining C++ Developer
jobs.description:
Company Description

Job Description...

The Unix Performance team is responsible for performance management, engineering of monitoring & problem determination tools, and clear documentation of findings. These positions (one Solaris, one Linux) require a strong understanding of Unix concepts, kernel internals, and low latency performance management.

The primary challenge of this position will be working across OS, application, and infrastructure teams to find the best solution to production system issues. This involves deep dives into system performance tools, application profiling, and the ability to effectively communicate between each of the interested parties, all within the constraints of a dynamic production environment.

The environment in which we work consists almost entirely of in-house developed code. Customers will primarily be the developers of this code. So there will be a requirement that the candidate speak fluently in terms and concepts that the developer is most familiar with.

Responsibilities:

Given a reported performance situation, find the source of the problem, develop potential solutions and drive the most acceptable solution.

Engineer problem determination tools for others to run. Document problem determination methods for others to follow.

Maintain existing solutions in shell, Perl, and C.

Respond to system API and performance related queries from application developers.

Drive required changes in vendor owned products.

Manage and prioritize work assignments in a demanding production environment.

Qualifications:

A deep understanding of Unix concepts to include performance considerations of each subsystem as well as the APIs used to access those subsystems.

The ability to develop new, and maintain existing, tools written in C, Korn, and Perl.

Understand C/C++ as well as the Unix system call interface.

C, shell, and performance tools/languages are a requirement (5+ years experience). Perl, Python, Java, C++, and the ability to work in other languages will only make you more productive.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

jobs.title: Sr. Software Engineer, C++ Build Infrastructure
jobs.description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen...

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

At Adobe, we are on a mission to revolutionize the way Adobe applications are built, deployed, and maintained. As a leader in creativity and innovation, we are seeking a skilled and passionate Sr. Software Engineer to join our team and take charge of developing and managing our proprietary build system. This role presents a unique opportunity to shape the future of build processes for Adobe-based applications and contribute to the success of our innovative products. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will play a crucial role in enhancing the development process, optimizing infrastructure, and ensuring the smooth and efficient delivery of Photoshop, Premiere Pro, After Effects, and more to millions of users worldwide.

Join our passionate team of experts and be at the forefront of developing and delivering Adobe Photoshop to millions of creative minds worldwide.

What You'll Do

Build System Development and Enhancement:
• Lead the design, development, and continuous improvement of our in-house build system, tailored specifically for Adobe-based applications.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, understand build pipeline needs, and develop efficient solutions that optimize build times and reduce development bottlenecks.
• Design and develop a scalable cross-platform configuration-driven workflow to build software projects with multiple nested dependencies.
• Propose build and deployment mechanisms for cloud-based services and external developer-facing APIs.
• Support compilation using various compilers on multiple platforms and architectures such as Windows, macOS, iOS, Linux, Android, WASM, arm, and x64

Team Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing:
• Collaborate with software development teams to provide guidance and support in optimizing software build
• Maintain documented standard processes for software build
• Foster a culture of collaboration and mentorship, assisting junior team members in building their expertise in build and DevOps practices.

Continuous Integration and Delivery:
• Implement and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines using the build system, automating the entire build, testing, and deployment process for Adobe applications.
• Ensure the reliability and scalability of the CI/CD infrastructure to meet the demands of a fast-paced development environment.

Infrastructure Management:
• Manage and maintain the cloud-based infrastructure and resources required for the build system and other DevOps-related services.
• Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and proactively identify areas for improvement to guarantee smooth operations.
• Build System Maintenance:
• Oversee the day-to-day operation of the build system, ensuring its reliability and availability for the development teams.
• Perform system upgrades, patches, and fixes as necessary to maintain optimal performance and security.

What you need to succeed
• 10+ years as a software engineer.
• 5+ years of established practice in designing products for developers, e.g., SDKs, libraries, and open-source software.
• Deep understanding of C/C++ compilation model, including linking.
• Familiarity with modern C++ (11 onwards).
• High proficiency in Python and/or JavaScript including asynchronous programming.
• Ability to write comprehensive and clear documentation with attention to detail and polish.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues effectively.
• Effective communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams and Passionate for improving tools and processes to improve the efficiency of others.

Great to have
• Experience building and maintaining highly complex build systems with cloud-based artifact repositories, monorepos, and external libraries surfaced through well-designed APIs.
• Experience with build systems (CMake, Buck, Bazel, Ninja, etc.).
• Experience with Visual Studio and Xcode projects.
• Contributions to large open-source projects. Experience writing software used by other developers in a self-serve model.

#CPP-All1

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $146,400 -- $275,000 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.

Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.

Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
